item.title: What is Epidemiology?
item.description: Epidemiology has been defined as “the study of the distribution and determinants of disease frequency”. As definition implies, the study of epidemiology contains two major components: Description of data Causal analysis Descriptive epidemiology The first part of Epidemiology is to study the distribution of disease, or more simply put, is to describe disease data. Distribution = describing the pattern of an illness in terms of person, place, and time. Person: Who has disease (Demographic characteristics: age, sex, ethnicity, etc) Place: Is this disease equally spatially distributed?
